Jose.src.characters

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • Jose.src.characters.Character
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Boo, Player, Robot

    public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class that is to be extended by all characters in the game.
    Author:
    Dzejrou

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  Character.DIRECTION
      Enum that denotes the three possible directions.

    • Field Summary

      List of climbable tiles (ladders) in the current level's map.

      Special instance of animation all characters need to have, used for rendering and collision detection.

      Current direction of the character.

      Reference to the current level's map.
      protected float offset_x
      Offset for the bounding box, since it does not always have to be located in the top left corner of the sprite.

      Offset for the bounding box, since it does not always have to be located in the top left corner of the sprite.

      List of all platforms in the current level.

        protected Character.DIRECTION curr_dir
        Current direction of the character.

      • view

        protected View view
        Reference to the game's view object.

      • debug

        public static boolean debug
        Boolean value that indicates if the debug mode is on. Used to check if the hitboxes and other info should be drawn. Can be changed from within the JoseMain class (kept here for easy access by characters) if the debug_possible variable is set to true.

      • platforms

        protected java.util.List<Platform> platforms
        List of all platforms in the current level.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character(org.newdawn.slick.tiled.TiledMap m,
                 float pos_x,
                 float pos_y,
                 View v,
                 java.util.List<Platform> p)
        Constructor that spawns a new character on a given coordinates and "binds" them to a level map (collision checking etc). Also loads all solid, climbable and lethal tiles as arrays of rectangles used for collisions with them.
        Parameters:
        m - Reference to the map of the current level.
        pos_x - Starting X axis coordinate.
        pos_y - Starting Y axis coordinate.
        p - List of all platforms in the level.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public abstract void update(long delta)
        Updates all logic (movement, collisions ...) of the character.
        Parameters:
        delta - Time elapsed from the last update call.

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
        Draws the character (and possible debug info).
        Parameters:
        g - Reference to the game's graphics context.

      • is_dead

        public abstract boolean is_dead()
        Checks if the character is dead.
        Returns:
        True if the character is dead, false otherwise.

      • die

        public abstract void die()
        Kills the character.

      • get_bounds

        public org.newdawn.slick.geom.Rectangle get_bounds()
        Returns the bounding rectangle of this character, used for collision detection.
        Returns:
        New instance of the class Rectangle that has the same position and size as the character.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Character other)
        Method that checks if this character intersects the bounding rectangle of another character.
        Parameters:
        other - The other character.
        Returns:
        True if the two characters intersect, false otherwise.

      • is_solid

        protected boolean is_solid(float x,
                           float y)
        Method that checks if the tile containing a given point in space is solid.
        Parameters:
        x - X axis coordinate.
        y - Y axis coordinate.
        Returns:
        True if the tile is solid, false otherwise.

      • on_solid_ground

        public boolean on_solid_ground()
        Returns the value of the method is_solid with y coordinate pushed slightly below the character, used for gravity. Used just for convenience and better code readability.
        Returns:
        True if the character is standing on solid ground (and thus ignores gravity), false otherwise.

      • can_move_to

        public boolean can_move_to(float x,
                           float y)
        Simple negation of the method is_solid, used for better code readability in some places in the code.
        Parameters:
        x - X axis coordinate.
        y - Y axis coordinate.
        Returns:
        True if the character can move to a given point in the map, false otherwise.

      • can_climb

        protected boolean can_climb()
        Checks if the character can climb, i.e is standing on a climbable tile.
        Returns:
        True if the character can climb, false otherwise.
